channel.title: Blend on fREW Schmidt's Clog (Coffee Blog)
channel.description: Recent content in Blend on fREW Schmidt's Clog (Coffee Blog)

item.title: La Tacita Floral Gesha Blend
item.description: Sweet Maria’s La Tacita Floral proves that when it comes to espresso, a little Gesha cultivar goes a long way. To be fair, 1⁄3 is no small amount, and from the high level of floral flavor and aroma found in the shot, I’d believe it if I were told this was 100% Gesha cultivar. We roasted several batches of this blend, and some of my favorites were on the lighter end of the roast spectrum, but with stretched roast times.

item.title: Jeff's Roast
item.description: 0.3lb El Salvador Finca Santa Julia Bourbon 0.2lb El Salvador Alpina Pacamara 0.2 lb Colombia Nariño Rio Juanambú 0.2 lb Panama Volcan Baru Bambito 0.2lb Kenya Muranga Riakiberu AA Roast Notes Jeff requested a “dark roast” so I went all the way to french. I was surprised that it didn’t take longer! It was incredibly smoky and took quite a while to cool the beans.
